dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mom and Dad are on their way to visit Brad--sitting in t gas pumps.  Kirk Idle is giving Dad an extra gallon.  We behind them that reads--  "Regular Customers only--No accounts  No credit cards--No cheques"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   Hey.  I caught the Breakfast Show.  Janet was a k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   Yeah she looked terrific.  Sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Dad looks angry at this.  Kirk swallows.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   Sexy and yet at the same time {searches for a wor "Fresh"--untouched--you know.  How's Brad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM AND DAD: {quickly} He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Dad hands Kirk some dollars}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   No.  That's all right. {rejecting money}  Lucky d pretty girl like that for a wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Dad gets in the car quickly}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Oh yeah he sure is.  Ah.  Thanks for the gas, Kir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   Well, you scratch my back {They drive off} and I' daughter's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 29 BETTY'S OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty on phone to Oliver}  BETTY:  She was like a different person, Oliver.  A fanta Farley.  And one look at those "Mac Kinleys"--listen, if treatment from them, well...  {Oliver's voice barks instructions}  I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 30 DENTONVALE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mom and Dad are visiting Brad.  Suddenly the door flies sweeps into the room.  Brad is bound and gagged and strai bonds.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I've just come to tell you how fabulous I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    My God, Janet!  How can you say such things?  Loo what they've done to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac, Nation and Scotty follow in}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    There's going to have to be an inquiry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    There are regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    Well..It's

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  For his own good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC: {relieved} Of course.  He was in great danger of har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: We only want what's best for him, as parents you understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    No.  No I don't.  He doesn't have to be trussed u turkey.  There are drugs that can keep him quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: We used them.  All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    And none of them worked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Then double the strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: We did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    We know our job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: And we also know how you feel, we're not stranger

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    We're not confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Well I am God damn it!  {He turns to Janet}  You with...with...this {he points to Mac} in the dress.!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Song "Shock Treatment"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    I'm not a locum with motive to suture myself  I've been a cynic for too many years  Playing doctor and nursey can be good for your health  I've seen clinics with those gimmicks in Tangiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac and Nation demonstrate their techniques on Scotty--p exploit his pretence at being wheelchair bound.  Scotty i realises he must go along with their plans.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {to parents}      But if you open your heart to a smooth operator  He'll take you for all that you've got  Then he'll hand you a curse that'll be with you later  It'll shake you the way he takes off like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    You need a bit of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Ooohhh Shock Treatment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    Get you jumping like a real live wire...Need a bi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Ooohh Shock Treatment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    So look out mister don't blow your last resistor  For a sister who will mystify yah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    {to Brad}  You're blinded by romance and blinded by science  Your condition is critically grave  But don't expect mercy from such an alliance  Suspicion of tradition's so new wave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a bit of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Repeat chorus during which Scotty gets a few volts--whic and about--pretending the 'shock treatment' has cured him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They dance through.  We see Ansalong with Ricky, the mal compromising situation.  They move on.  Ansalong and Rick join in.  Scotty has started dancing.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac, Nation Scotty and Janet piles in the car.  Ansalong and Dad wave goodbye.  They pull away like celebrities.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The bushes move and we see Oliver and Betty spying with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {incredulous}  Look.  Look at that, Dr. Scott's wa Dancing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Yes.  Macabre isn't it?  Right down their garden

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 31 DENTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We have a driving sequence as Janet, Scotty, Mac and Nat towards the Leisure Center.  The residents of the town ga Nation starts to sing a little song which they all pick u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG "Carte Blanche"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: Carte blanche is like an avalanche   It kind of snowballs and sets you free

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Carte blanche is like an avalanche   It kind of snowballs and sets you free  Ooooh Ooooh Ooooh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Populace wave.  Many wear "F.F" T shirts.  Janet starts new role.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Carte blanche is like an avalanche   It kind of snowballs and sets you free  Ooooh Ooooh Ooooh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet starts to respond to waving locals}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  So if you're looking for a standard   To which you should aspire then babies  Look at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac and Nation look uneasy at this response.  Janet is e and is beginning to believe her own publicity.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 32 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The car pulls up in what seems to be the expected celebr see the front of the building with a huge picture of Farl best Red Square tradition.  There is a lot of activity as for the opening.  We see a sign going up, reading "*Grand Tonite--in the presence of Farley Flavors, Janet Majors a people of Denton*".}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph Hapschatt and his staff who are all in "F.F." unif the steps to greet Janet.  A few kids stand to one side. autograph books etc.  Among their numbers we see Brenda D brother Oscar and Glish Davison (Brenda's boyfriend).  Th Janet's arrival.  Ralph steps forward.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Hi, Janet!  Welcome to the F.F. Leisure Center. excited about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  {indicating Farley's huge picture}  Do I get one

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  {embarrassed} Uh...yeah...yes...It's being done n his assistant Macy Struthers a 'Get with it' look}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACY:   {grinning a fixed, some might say plastic, smile} Struthers--Reception Executive and second-in-charge Perso Co-ordinator. {She almost salutes}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Ah, Macy.  Why don't you take Janet to the Poolsi can freshen up before the courtesy tour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACY:   Surely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Flash bulbs pop.  Brenda pushes through.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: {to Ralph}  You promised me an introduction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH: {embarrassed}  Later, Brenda.  Ah, Scotty, could y moment in my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY: {giving Mac and Nation a superior look}  Of cours Ralph.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac and Nation exchange looks and follow Janet and Macy. Brenda, Oscar and friends move towards pool area}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISH DAVISON: {to Brenda}  Who are those creeps with Jan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: They're no creeps!  {Superior tone}  *Ralph* says neuro-diagnosticians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISH:  Oh yeah.  When did Ralph say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: {taunting boyfriend} Never you mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Pool area is undergoing finishing touches.  Main pool is bandstand garlanded in decorations.  Electronic machines and sign boldly proclaiming leisure areas.  'Steam Room', 'Bowling Alley', 'Kids' Playground', etc.  Mac, Nation, J heading into a lift.  Scotty and Ralph through a door mar A reporter in sunglasses waits in the lift.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER:  I'm an investigative reporter from the Denton me, Janet, what will you be representing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {stepping out of lift} Sanity for today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Macy opens door to suite.  All enter.  She slams it in r Brenda leads chanting below: 'We want Janet'.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph and Scotty hover by telex machines in office overl Ralph holds F.F. schedule.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Brad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY:  A wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Check.  The quacks are willing tools?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY: Fools!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Check.  Janet?  Wow.  I wouldn't mind doing her o favours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY: Time to telex Flavors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They do.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet and co. are relaxing in luxury.  Nation mixes cock Chanting in the background.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACY: {a bit thin-lipped}  Anything else you'd like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  Yes.  A new carpet.  I hate the colour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Macy leaves.  Chanting rises as door opens and closes.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: It's only one night, Janet.  Let's not forget who this for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:   Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:     Brad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {megalomania has taken over}  I'm sick of hearing dog.  I've got a lot going for me.  I'm going places.  I' someone.  I'm gonna win my way into the lives and hearts if I have to kill to do it.  I'll make the pathetic littl me.  I don't even know why I'm wasting my time here with be with my people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet slams out onto balcony.  Cheers rise.  Mac gives N Nation produces a powder with which she laces cocktail.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {On the balcony.  Janet is waving.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWD (GLISH):  You're great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {humbly} Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: Hi!  My names' Brenda Drill.  I think you're beau my brother Oscar and my boyfriend Glish Davison...you're really are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:  Are you a rock singer?  I bet she's a rock singer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISH:  Yeah.  I saw the breakfast show.  You're terrific

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: Your clothes are real neat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Nation appears with Janet's drink containing sedative.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: This is Janet.  She's a phenomenon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd goes wild.  Nation hands the drink and draws Janet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you need a little rest.  You've got a big night a you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {drinking} I'm not tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {She wilts and Mac appears to drag her inside.  The windo the curtains.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 33 Newspaper Montage

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Papers are coming hot off the press.  Headline reads:  "Local Girl Pips Fast Food Pharaoh in Pop Poll"  Large picture of Janet.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We see papers thrown from vans.  Spotty paperboy bellows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY:    Denton girl gets lucky!  Souvenir edition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mr. Clark, the banker, buys several copies.  He is with reporter.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK:  Great story, Tom.  This could bring big money to Investment from the F.F. chain is an attractive speculati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They head down street.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, is tonight black tie...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY:    Extra!  Extra!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 34 The Library

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Oliver is behind a pile of books...We see pages being fl indexes under 'M', 'Mac', 'Mac Kinley'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: I'm sure I know that name from the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  Well whoever they are, they seem most persuasive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {flipping pages}  Yes, Betty but the *false* prom dawn is usually followed by a most bloody sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {impressed}  Why, Oliver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty is about to compliment his turn of phrase when she of the librarian, about to pin up a poster.  It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the Presence of   "FARLEY FLAVORS"  with  THE FABULOUS JANET  (As seen on T.V.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dress to Impress!  Attire to Inspire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LIBRARIAN:  Isn't this exciting?  I've had a George Sand in my closet since graduation.  I can't wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty gives her a patronising smile.  The librarian exit down the poster.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  Oh, Oliver...What are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Camera reveals Farley perusing newspaper identical to cl "Denton Dossier"--date 1950--headline 'Twins Tragedy'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 35 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brad is still bound and gagged and feverish...Mom and Da They look very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    Oh, what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Well...maybe I could wear my black patent leather

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    Too flashy...{Brad moans}  It's all right, Brad d another sedative...we'll miss you at the party tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mom gives Brad a pill and they leave, passing Ansalong o telephone.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANSALONG:  Sure, I'm going...Well, I guess I might wear m uniform...It's generally welcome anywhere...You're wearin MMMMMMMMM...Bye.  {Phone down}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Listen.  If you are wearing your uniform tonight. you are...take a few inches off the hem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANSALONG:  Do you think so?  Perhaps you're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    I know I'm right.  Bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANSALONG:  Bye...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We follow Mom and Dad across to their car.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Maybe those Italian loafers I bought in Hawaii mi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 36 Dentonvale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Back in his cell, sedated, Brad enters a delirious sleep appears--dream-like--muttering "I've just come to tell yo I am".}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 37 Leisure Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet tosses and turns in her sedated stupor.  We pull i She moans a little.  She's having an erotic but troubled dissolve to images of Brad and her together.  Mac and Nat scientifically monitoring their passion.  The door opens of Farley stands in the shadows.  Brad becomes Farley.  F Brad.  Mac and Nation laugh.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY: {V.O.} Face up to it, Janet.  He's an emotional c

dialogues.speaker: FARLEY
dialogues.text: Time's tight, Janet  Do it right, Janet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD: {V.O.} Until tonight, Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {She wakes up.  Guitar riff from next song starts throbbi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet is in a disturbed state.  She decides to run.  She curtains, peeps out and spots Mac and Nation on the balco recoils to the door of the room.  It's locked.  She looks windows that overlook the car park.  Ralph is just finish the erection of her picture and her name in plexiglass. to a door at the other end of the room.  It's a pass door suite, one which is being prepared for Farley Flavors.  T from which she pours herself a large drink.  There are so out, from which she selects a fedora, dark glasses and a She takes another belt of booze, leaves the room and work towards the main entrance.  We see Ralph coming back into Reporters descend on him.  Janet hides.  We pick up Ralph walks towards where Janet is concealed, followed by newsh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Yes...*SHE* will be staying here until tomorrow.. rooms here in the Center over to her and her party...No! what her next move will be...but you can be sure of one t starts here...gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {He passes by.  Janet moves quickly towards the exit.  Fr we see Janet going out of the building and Ralph glancing her direction as he makes his way to the poolside balcony gang are shouting "Janet--Janet--We want Janet".}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    Shut up.  Shut up.  She's sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA & CO: {whisper} Janet--Janet--We want Janet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph reaches Mac and Nation.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Message from F.F.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Silence.  Nation unlocks door.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC:    She's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH: {remembers the figure he saw}  Struthers!  Check t lot!!  I'll call Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Confusion reigns.  Oscar and Glish form search party.  B approaches Ralph.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: {coyly} If you need a stand-in...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 38 Denton Streets.  Night

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Incognito Janet is cruising the streets of downtown Dent an edge of desperation as she sings.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG: "Looking for Trade"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I'm in a cul-de-sac  An' I've got to go back  So c'mon feet  We gotta hit the street  We got it made...  I'm looking for trade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 39 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brad tosses and turns in his sleep.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   I'm lookin' for love

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 40 Denton Streets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet cruises on foot.  Parker in patrol car is cruising direction.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {During chorus the unemployed sons of Denton lounge again windows.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need it now  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  An' I'm gonna get it somehow  I'm in a dead-end street  Like a dog in heat  I'm like a kid with no toys   I gotta get those boys  Oohh I can't be delayed  I'm looking for trade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 41 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brad sweats.  Janet's image appears in his dream.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   I'm looking for love

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 42 Electronic Games Arcade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The delinquents of Denton are whizzing and firing their rhythm.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    We're all living like there's no tomorrow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  And the way things are going that's probably true But without you and me sis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {She looks at her reflection}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world'd fall to pieces  Vena Cava who's the raver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Our raving saviour, that's you!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 43 Pool Room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Parker's car drifts past entrance.  Janet is inside.  Th click in rhythm.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I'm on the primrose path  Looking for a laugh  Remember blood must run  For the chosen one  There are games to be played  Looking for trade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 44 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brad's dream.  He and Janet.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   I'm looking for love

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 44 Bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet is drinking, surrounded by trade.  Glasses clink.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  I need some

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Young blood  I need it now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Repeat twice.  Oscar, Glish and col enter the bar.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  And I'm gonna get it somehow  I'm looking for trade

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:  Janet, they're lookin' for you all over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {drunk and slurring} It's nice to be needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISH:  You've got to come back.  We want to play at your

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:  Yeah.  We're a band and my sister Brenda persuade us play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARMAN: Yer under age.  Scram.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  Whateryer called, yer band?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR: {proudly} Oscar Drill and the Bits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Parker enters, spots Janet, looks embarrassed but offici

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  Come on, Bits.  Looks like our cab's arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They head off.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 46 Helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We see Farley running towards us.  He ducks under the ro and climbs in.  The door slams behind him.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {V.O.} He was a president.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: President?  Past Presidents!!!  Betty, I think yo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {V.O.}  Oh really?  {She appears.}  How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty appears in a sexy combat outfit.  She looks astoni stands up and we see he is wearing the W.W.2 equivalent.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {clutches his heart}  Charming...quite...charming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Gunshot resounds.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 48 Janet's Parents' Place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet's mom has fancy-dressed herself into a gun-toting fires caps at a mirror.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Song: "Look What You Did To My Id"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    Like a chirp in a down town nitery  I'll be higher than a flyer has a right to be  The art will start when I play my part  As the tart with the golden heart  Oh look what you did to my id

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Dad is in the next room.  He's wearing a 1940's Zoot Sui

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Like Genesis this really is a first for me  I'm really glad that Janet laid this curse on me  I'm a brute in a cute zoot suit  That wants to put in the boot, shoot and loot  Oh look what you did to my id

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 49 TV Studio  {Neely slipping into her 'on-camera' party outfit.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  Like a good-time girl I couldn't feel much finer  Got a deep plum lipstick an' new eye-liner  These bitch-heels are so damn vicious  I feel weak with pleasure and so delicious  Oh look what you did to my id...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 50 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac and Nation changing into doctors' coats, stethoscope head-mirrors.}

dialogues.speaker: MAC AND NATION
dialogues.text: When there's heaven in the music  Hell is in control  The angels got the voices  But the devil got the rock and roll...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Scotty changing into jack-boots and lederhosen}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SCOTTY: This could be the start of a whole career here  This could take me to a town that's nowhere near here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 51 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph ties bow-tie}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  To Betty I'm a chauvinistic ignoramus  But I'm gonna find a way to wind up being famous  Oh look what you did to my id

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 52 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ansalong finishes alterations to uniform}

dialogues.speaker: ANSALONG
dialogues.text: Got the hot flush symptoms an' I'm feeling freaky  Got my hem so high they'll say I'm being cheeky

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 53 Parker's Place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Bathroom of Officer Vance Parker.  He's in the bath (bub his leg stretched out and is soaping it in a languid mann sings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PARKER: Male Caucasian tall and handsome  With legs like mine I'm really made for dancin'  Oh look what you did to my id...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 54 Bank Vault

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mr. Clark is in his vault opening a security locker reve magazines and manacles.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLARK:  With my stocks and bonds I will secure completely A sizeable prize even if the whole bunch beat me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 55 Gas Station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Kirk has just poured himself into skin tight light silk overalls and he now pours himself into his custom car...}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KIRK:   Feeling tuned and tight now that I've customised If I win tonight a'well it won't surprise me  Woah look what you did to my id

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 56 Brenda's Place

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brenda looks great in her party outfit}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda: In the best dressed contest  There's bound to be some jealousy  But the best dressed guest with whom I'm most impressed.. Is *ME* !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 57 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We cut to the road outside the center...We see everyone walk.  Ride bikes...Motorcycles...Come in cars...There ar cameras, TV mobiles...Anything and everything with a town partying}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    You may say that we're being sexist  An' we've got egos that are bigger than Texas  But look what you did to my id  Kid  Look what you did to my id

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 58 {Outside Dentonvale}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The VW drives into view and Oliver hops out.  He gives f instructions to Betty.  The light from Brad's room glows sky.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {military style} OK, Betty.  You have thirty minu the studios and search Scott's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  What am I looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {revs engine} OK, Oliver.  Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Thanks, Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  Oh, and Oliver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Yes, Betty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:   Be circumspect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 59 The Leisure Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Nation has organised a shower and coffee to sober Janet Janet is behaving like a small child.  Mac is seething. wit mesmerised; like most people they are mistaking histr greatness.  Macy Struthers and Nation drag Janet from the help her into a chair.  Oscar pushes coffee toward her. to dry Janet's hair.  Macy crosses to the door looking at showing signs of nervousness.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {murmurs} Brad!  Oh, Brad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {impatient} He's a lame dog, remember?  But even want to see you like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The door opens.  Ralph is there with newshounds.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTERS: {V.O.s}  Well, can we see her--Look, I've come the copy isn't ready in the next half hour it's forget ti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Later, boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {He closes the door--Macy indicates Janet}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH: {continues}  How is she?  {Macy shrugs and pulls a Well, I just got word Farley's landing any minute.  You g and Glish}  Get yer asses down on that stage and try and a reputation.  Okay?  *Move*!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph rushes out followed by Macy}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Oscar and Glish shuffle a bit--Oscar puts a couple of gr the table}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:   For you, Janet--they'll make you feel real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLISH: {awkwardly} yeah, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They exit.  Nation skillfully pops her own pill into Jan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION:  Amateurs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 60. TV Station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Reception area--a monitor set shows activity at Leisure tried to look as though she's there on legitimate busines kind  of difficult in commando gear).  A colleague approaches h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV COLLEAGUE:  Oh hi, Betty -- I thought you'd be at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  Oh--I couldn't think what to wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV COLLEAGUE:  Oh--Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty walks on and studies a wall chart until the other vanished, then quickly enters Scotty's office--Acting lik she scouts around--We see a monitor which is flickering s we see Neely Pritt reporting live from the Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 61 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Party in full swing.  Everyone dressed to their notion o correct--formal to overdressed--casual to bizarre.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  An' so if you're a follower of exotic fashion you to keep you going here in Denton tonight...and naturally, excitement and not wishing to stick out like a sore thumb an outfit of my own together...an' this is it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {She tries at first to be the reporter in a funny costume see a look in her eyes that says...*LOOK* at *ME*.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 62 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We see a flashlight playing around the room.  It settles drawer...We close in on it and see a hand open it...We se Oliver...He takes out some passports...They read: Brazil ... and Morocco... He flips them open and we see a Cosmo Harding... Cosmo and Nation Coolidge... Cosmo and Nation Oliver sighs with satisfaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Quacks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The door rattles...Oliver kills the light.  He crosses t slowly turns the tumbler lock...Then with the quickness o younger man he throws the door open and grabs the person side...It's Ricky!  He's terrified by Oliver's commando o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Well, well!  An accessory before and after the fa saw one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ricky looks more startled.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {bluffing}  Brad Majors' room and hurry, otherwis the first martyr of the revolution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICKY: {bluffed}  Revolution?  Ah--sure, this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 63 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The crowd surges around us like a stormy sea...Amidst cr your T-shirts and posters" and enthusiastic greetings fro veer over to Brenda Drill who's organising some kids into In the background Oscar Drill's band is tuning up.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: Okay?  So let's do the "J-A-N-E-T" again.  {They letters}  Yeah, that's okay...right...*I'm* going to walk *her*, okay... and *you'll* be waiting down here to clear *her* to come out... and *she* and *I* will come through the chant...Meanwhile *I* think one of us should wait out room.  Why don't we all go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They race away...We pan with them.  The noise of the cro and our image blurs with moving bodies...}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 64 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ricky and Olly are helping Brad (who is still wearing a along the corridor.  As they pass the phone it starts to a moment of indecision--Olly picks it up and holds it out of them to listen.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 65 The Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The boys have tuned up.  The crowd roar.  Ralph steps up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Ladies and gentlemen--Denton's own--with --{he re Suburban Garage Sound".  Let's hear it for Oscar Drill an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The crowd cheer--guitars rip into intro.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 66 TV Station

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty's on the phone in Scotty's office.  She holds the Dossier' turning the pages to 'Twins Tragedy' clip}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  Oliver?  You were right.  I just can't believe it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {V.O.} This is one time charity didn't begin at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty turns page to reveal baby and adult photos of Brad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  And they're so alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We pan up to the monitor and "The Bits".}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 67 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Oscar is singing his heart out}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG: "Breaking-Out"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:  I know how it feels to be coolin' my heels  I've been down on them long enough  But if I take to them now  Then maybe somehow  You'll see through the bluff  Of my playing it tough

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 68 Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brad in strait jacket is piled into ambulance by Oliver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver: To a family reunion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 69 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OSCAR:  I've been a lifetime on deposit  And that's a long time in the closet  And if you say to me 'How was it?'  It was hard taking that heart breaking  God-forsaken route  But I'm b-b-b-breaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 70  Dentonvale

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ambulance roars through the night}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 71  Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet's suite.  We hear Oscar on P.A.  Macy helps her dr stares, frozen, into a mirror.}

dialogues.speaker: OSCAR
dialogues.text: You may say that you'd choose  To be in my shoes  But look what it did for me  I got buried alive  I don't thrive on that jive  Look and you'll see  That my spikes don't fit me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 72 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd, led by Brenda, dance up a storm.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHORUS: We've been a lifetime on deposit   That's a long time in the closet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 73 Denton streets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty puts her foot down in the VW.  A helicopter is hea

dialogues.speaker: CHORUS
dialogues.text: And if you say to us 'How was it?'  It was hard taking that heart breaking  God-forsaken route  But we're b-b-b-breaking out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Helicopter passes overhead}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 74 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Big finish--band and chorus go wild}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHORUS: We're b-b-b-breaking out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Helicopter is heard.  Cries of "It's him", "Farley's arr everyone rushes upstairs to rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 75 Rooftop -- Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Chopper lands.  Flashbulbs pop.  Fireworks ignite.  Farl greeted by Ralph and Scotty.  Flavors takes big breath an poses.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Neely Pritt moves towards Farley Flavors.  She keeps tur camera and treating us as viewers.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  And so at last he's here--the man who is responsi tonight's festivities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {She reaches him and shoves the microphone at him.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY: {continues}  Mr Flavors--may we have a moment of y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY {magnanimous}:  Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  We've heard rumours that you're going to unveil m the Leisure Center tonight.  Is this true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: Perfectly correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  Could you tell us a little about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: Let's just say that I'm putting Sanity back on th great Nation of ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY:  And how does "local girl" Janet Majors fit into t things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: Very nicely --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {He catches Ralph's arm and moves away from Neely.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY {aside to Ralph indicating Janet's picture} {conti billing's too big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph smarts, then indicates to Macy, 'Take it down.'  P with pilot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT {ironically} Nice little town you've got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VANCE:  {grim} We like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Fireworks explode.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 76 Road to Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ambulance traveling with Brad and Oliver.  Ricky drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: Since you were separated at birth, he's followed move...and he's resented you all these years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   And Janet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: She represents everything he was denied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Fireworks explode}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 77 Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Farley, Ralph, Scotty, Mac and Nation are seated around in Farley's suite.  A picture of Farley hovers behind the smoke fills the air.  Macy stands at the door.  Farley wi stirring speech.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: ...and she represents everything that our custome Innocence, decency and the illusion of a happy ending.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MACY: {stepping though door} I'll go get her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: And behind her image the Dentonvale Chain of Take will thrive in the capable hands of two great ethical int operating on the frontiers of medical science {indicating Nation} ... coupled with the managerial genius of... {Sco "Ralph"} Ralph.  All under the firm guidance of a great s treacherous sea of diplomacy-- Everett Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Applause.  Meeting breaks up.  Ralph and Scotty inspect display' -- therapy cassettes, domestic restraint jackets entitled 'A Menu for Sanity', etc.  Farley crosses to Mac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: I'd like to thank you for taking the neurosis out life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Door opens.  Macy escorts Janet in.  She stares at Farle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: {continues} Janet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  {amazed at resemblance} Brad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 78 Exterior Leisure Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Betty's VW pulls in front of building.  She is illuminat as she steps out of car.  A siren sounds behind her and s the ambulance pull into the entrance.  TV trucks surround and PA systems.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH and VO: And here she is!  Our very own!  America's World's Example!  Janet...The Sensation of the Planet!  { bring you...MISS MENTAL HEALTH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The crowd go wild...Oliver, Betty, Brad and Ricky run up entrance.  Guard on steps observes Brad's strait jacket.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUARD: {to other sentry}  That guy's sure to win the cost

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 79 Leisure Center Interior

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We hear a fanfare and see Janet appear at the far end of steps onto a catwalk which is running the entire length o pool...Nation, Mac and Scotty are waiting on a festooned diving board...Nation has the microphone.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {PA} Isn't she lovely?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM: {shouts} Mommy and Daddy love you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {PA} She walks in beauty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM: {shouts} We love you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {PA} We all love Janet...Who do we love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL: {shout} *JANET*!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {PA} The dress Janet is wearing has been given by Creme Modes of Downtown Denton, and we've been asked that of the individual styling and exquisite tailoring...This the many gifts that have been so freely and generously gi the first of (we hope) many Miss Mental Healths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Brenda Drill preens at this remark.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL: Hooray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VOICE IN THE CROWD:  Let the President through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We pick up Oliver, Betty, Brad at the far end of the poo get through the crowd.  Ricky has found Ansalong.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY: {to Oliver} {astonished} The President's here...et

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The crowd parts and we see a rather nasty little man pop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRESIDENT:  I'm Irwin Lappsy...President of Lappsy Auto.. my hand some keys...keys that I want to give to this litt being honoured here tonight...And I wanna tell you...that little Lady takes these same keys out to the parking lot this wonderful Leisure Complex...She'll find that they fi something...and what that something is...is a...*BRAND NE LUXE...*EIGHT CYLINDER CONVERTIBLE!!*  COMPLETE With  *RADIO*...*TAPEDECK*...*WASHABLE SEAT COVERS* and many ma extras...an' it's all hers for absolutely free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {He hands *Mac* the keys.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL:    Wow...Yeah...Hooray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    You're beautiful, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Ralph steps back to the mike intercepting Mac who had th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  Well, Janet's absolutely speechless, ladies and g that's alright.  Because we don't need her to talk...We j meet someone who needs no introduction.........

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd cheer}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A...Mister...Farley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROWD: {scream} FLAVORS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Fanfare.  Farley enters grinning and waving.  Cheers as microphone.  Scotty pipes in organ underscoring--preacher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: My friends.  Tonight, in declaring this temple of officially open, we are taking the first step of defiance something that will grow so big that the whole world will its sound.  And wherever our slogan 'SANITY AND VANITY' i will be linked incontrovertibly with this night...this to this...beautiful...face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Farley approaches Janet.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD: {shouts from crowd} SEDUCER!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {chord}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: {amazed} And who are you, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {chord}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD: {defiant} Your twin brother!  And your accuser!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {General consternation.  Janet looks from one to another. indeed identical.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  Brad!  {Runs to him}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC: {to Parker}  Arrest that man!  He's committed to our

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET: {to Mac} I never signed the papers.  He's not goin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {chord}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: {to Farley} To revenge your twin--you tried to ab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: This is all very sad and you're very confused, si

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   Then why did you choose her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: I don't.  I refuse her.  And you!...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG: "Duel-Duet"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {During this song the twins confront each other on the ca like a jousting tournament.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: You're a lose...an abomination   In the eyes of any sensitive man

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   An' you're a blind alley cruiser  Always heading down a losing straight  Dreamin' that you're screamin' at fate  You're a dead-end, dead-beat no-where mister  With a kiss like a Mississippi alligator's sister

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: I've took as much of you as any man can  You've lost your heart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   You've lost your cause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: You lost your baby when you lost your balls  You've lost your mind, you've lost your grip  So say bye bye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   We lost our mom, we lost our dad  An' if I'm losing you, well that's just too bad

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: Well, the best thing you could ever do...is die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   You're a failure...  A malformation in the guise of many, an also-ran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: An' you're a weeper and a wailer  Always treading on the toes of the great  Generally spreading your weight  You're a spiteful, hateful asinine creature  A pupil with no scruples who knew better than the teacher

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   I've took as much of you as any man can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: You've lost your heart

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   You've lost your cause

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: You lost your baby when you lost your balls  You've lost your mind, you've lost your grip  So say bye bye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   We lost our home and our family  You've lost compassion, now you're losing me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: The best thing you could ever do is die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   The best thing you could ever do is die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOTH:   The best thing you could ever do is die

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They finish up nose to nose screaming at each other...Fa who falls backwards into pool.  Janet rushes to him.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: Take no notice of him.  He's mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD: {spluttering} I'm as sane as you are.  Saner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Mac grabs microphone.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAC: {PA} And he was only with us for a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd jeer and laugh.  Ralph takes mike.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RALPH:  I hope Mr. Flavors will accept apologies on behal this unfortunate incident.  *Everyone* wants to be relate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd laugh--deriding Brad.  Janet comforts him.  Farley Furious.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: No offence!  On the contrary, this is a perfect e we're here to combat.  {He points at Brad, Janet, Oliver shouts--chanting} Out!  Out!  Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The crowd pick up chant until 'Out, out, out' becomes a and this quartet retreat in fear of their lives.  the cro to cheers.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: {triumphant} See how we got rid of that little pr *United*!  And that's how we're gonna clean up the minds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Cheers, whistles and take-away goods are being distribut nudges Ralph--Ralph indicates her to Farley.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY: {continues} {PA} {to Brenda}  Would you care to j here, Miss, as we inaugurate the Farley Flavors Fabulous Sanatorium...first of a chain that will span from coast t from continent to continent...Step up, please, Miss...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA: Brenda...Brenda Drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENDA'S MOTHER: Mommy loves you, Baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Janet's mom looks suicidal...Dad consoles}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOM:    What a nerve!  What a mouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD:    Shut up, Ruby, and listen to a success story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY PRITT: {in tears} I can't stand it.  Everything goo happens to other people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NATION: {sotto voce} This could be worse than the old day

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COSMO:  In the old days we didn't have a convertible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {He rattles the keys.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sc. 80  Steps of Leisure Center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Outside the Leisure Center we see Brad, Janet, Betty and shelter from the steps.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY'S VOICE: {from TV monitors} And remember.  Sanity path to a more hygienic tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {We hear the tiny voice of Neely Pritt coming from a TV m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEELY: {VO}  And Fast Food Giant Farley Flavors has given Health what can only be described as an official kiss of the crowd are loving it...Not much is known of the girl w of the crowd here tonight and into the shoes......etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The quartet are glum.  Janet's photograph is lowered in background.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANET:  Was I a victim of his heart  Or a victim of his schemes  Did he love me or resent you  Like a player in his dreams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd roars.  Images from 'inside' punctuate the followi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRAD:   Why don't we all get out of here  There's nothing left to lose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETTY:  No.  We have the power to think and feel  We have the power to choose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Crowd roars.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OLIVER: There's a cancer here among us  And it's gnawing at the heart  We can shake off the fetters  Of quacks and go-getters  And the way to begin -- is start!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {Music starts abruptly.  They sing and dance down the ste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SONG: "Anyhow! Anyhow!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARTET: Some people do it for compassion  Some people do it for the fashion  Some people do it to be funny  Some people do it for the money  Some people do it for enslavement  Some people do it on the pavement  But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {They dance through the deserted streets.  We see the nig with twinkling stars.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARTET: We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it -- no matter how the wind is blowing  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!  We're gonna do it -- We just gotta keep going

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people do it for each other {Brad and Janet smile}  Some people do it for their lovers {everyone smiles}  Some people do it for improvement {Oliver smiles}  Some people do it for the movement {Betty smiles}  Some people do it for enjoyment  Some people do it for employment

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {People of Denton have moved--mass baptism style--into th wear strait jackets.  Farley presides.  Many seem to be d hold back.  Ricky, Ansalong, Glish and Oscar shake their retreat.}

dialogues.speaker: DENTON CHORUS
dialogues.text: Denton! Denton! You've got no pretention!  You're where the heart is! You're okay!  Denton! Denton! I'd just like to mention  You're the acceptable face of the human race  You're Denton! Denton! ...Denton, USA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The quartet are superimposed over the pool image marchin into the camera.  They look wonderful.}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUARTET: We're gonna do it -- no matter how the wind is b We're gonna do it anyhow! Anyhow!   We're gonna do it -- We just gotta keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: {The quartet are joined by Ricky, Ansalong, Oscar and Gli band of outsiders.  Meanwhile the Leisure Center lights u lights like a giant fast food chainstore...All the window barred...Shadows of people move inside...Security guards sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FARLEY FLAVORS FABULOUS  *DENTONVALE SANATORIUM*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DIR: Dr. E.V. Scott (Vienna) MAN: R. Hapshatt  "IT ALL STARTED HERE"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDERS:      We're gonna do it -- We just gotta keep g
